title: At a loss for high ping (only in league)
body:
Patch 7.2 I believe was where this all started (or 1-2 after) and I recall people have reported similar issues at the time.  I live in Minnesota and ping 20-30 area to every Chicago server that exists and anything else in the area which would indicate to me there's no bad routing along the way causing high ping. Yet I fire up league and I have a nice stable 110-115 ping. Always assumed the issue was temporary and would go away, but it hasn't

Any and all suggestions are welcome! 85-90 ping is okay, 115 sucks imo

replies.body:
I followed the steps to flush my DNS cache through league's website:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#section-windows

I am going to try to play a game after having a game with 260 ms ping spikes from a normal ping of 14 ms and report the findings.

We've seen connection problems reported around the denver area, so your issue can be caused by something else unless you're routing through there for some reason.  We always recommend our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help troubleshoot connection instabilities as a first step, which should resolve this.  

If it persists, though, run a traceroute to 104.160.131.1 via [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and submit it in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team can look into this with you individually and figure out what's causing your specific problem.
